\title{CryptoEnv}
\date{May 27, 2022}
\release{0.1.1}
\author{Crinstaniev}
\newcommand{\sphinxlogo}{\vbox{}}
\renewcommand{\releasename}{Release}
\makeindex
\begin{document}

\pagestyle{empty}
\sphinxmaketitle
\pagestyle{plain}
\sphinxtableofcontents
\pagestyle{normal}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index::doc}}


\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{CryptoEnv} is a Python library for cryptocurrency researches by agent\sphinxhyphen{}based methods, including non\sphinxhyphen{}reinforcement learning and reinforcement learning algorithms.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This project is under development.
\end{sphinxadmonition}


\chapter{Installation}
\label{\detokenize{installation:installation}}\label{\detokenize{installation::doc}}

\section{Download From Source}
\label{\detokenize{installation:download-from-source}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
You can directly download the project from our GitHub repository:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
git clone https://github.com/crinstaniev/cryptoenv.git
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Install Using \sphinxtitleref{pip}}
\label{\detokenize{installation:install-using-pip}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Or you can use \sphinxtitleref{pip} to install

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
pip install crenv
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\chapter{API}
\label{\detokenize{api:api}}\label{\detokenize{api::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This section we provide the API definition and usages for our \sphinxtitleref{CryptoEnv} package.


\section{CryptoEnv}
\label{\detokenize{CryptoEnv:cryptoenv}}\label{\detokenize{CryptoEnv::doc}}\index{CryptoEnv (class in crypto\_env.core)@\spxentry{CryptoEnv}\spxextra{class in crypto\_env.core}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{CryptoEnv:crypto_env.core.CryptoEnv}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{crypto\_env.core.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{CryptoEnv}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{max\_sell}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{max\_buy}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{min\_sell}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{min\_buy}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{dataloader}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{{\hyperref[\detokenize{DataLoader:crypto_env.dataloader.DataLoader}]{\sphinxcrossref{crypto\_env.dataloader.dataloader.DataLoader}}}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{recorder}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{{\hyperref[\detokenize{Recorder:crypto_env.recorder.Recorder}]{\sphinxcrossref{crypto\_env.recorder.Recorder}}}}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{gym.core.Env}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{abc.ABC}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This is the core module of \sphinxtitleref{CrytoEnv}. It provide environment for agents to perform buy and sell actions and provide market states.

\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{fee\_type}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} ‘percentage’ or ‘fix’. Defaults to ‘percentage’.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{ETHLoader (class in crypto\_env.dataloader)@\spxentry{ETHLoader}\spxextra{class in crypto\_env.dataloader}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{DataLoader:crypto_env.dataloader.ETHLoader}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{crypto\_env.dataloader.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ETHLoader}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{base\_dir}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{start\_idx}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{end\_idx}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{features}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{list}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{dropna}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{download}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{True}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{url}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}https://raw.githubusercontent.com/coinmetrics/data/master/csv/eth.csv\textquotesingle{}}}}{}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Our example implementation of {\hyperref[\detokenize{DataLoader:crypto_env.dataloader.DataLoader}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{DataLoader}}}}} class. We use the Ethereum history data from the coinmetrics repo. See \sphinxurl{https://raw.githubusercontent.com/coinmetrics/data} for more details.

\section{Recorder}
\label{\detokenize{Recorder:recorder}}\label{\detokenize{Recorder::doc}}\index{Recorder (class in crypto\_env.recorder)@\spxentry{Recorder}\spxextra{class in crypto\_env.recorder}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Recorder:crypto_env.recorder.Recorder}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{crypto\_env.recorder.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Recorder}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{price\_list}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{crypto\_cap}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{0}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{fiat\_cap}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{1000}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This is the recorder class. A recorder object is able to record agent’s action in both training and production mod. The data collected can later be used for plotting or analyzing.
\index{\_\_init\_\_() (crypto\_env.recorder.Recorder method)@\spxentry{\_\_init\_\_()}\spxextra{crypto\_env.recorder.Recorder method}}

\item {}

\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
Plotly figure object

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}
